title: The Singer Songwriter Specialization
description: Write, perform, and record original music. Learn how to transform your ideas and emotions into songs that are uniquely you
prerequisites: Basic understanding of music theory is helpful but not mandatory.
Familiarity with playing an instrument (guitar, piano, etc.) is recommended.
A passion for music and songwriting is essential.
learning_outcomes: Transform ideas and emotions into original songs. Master songwriting techniques, performance skills, and music production. Record and produce your music effectively to craft unique songs.
price: Coursera subscriptions vary. Check the Coursera website for current pricing.

title: How to Play Guitar Specialization
description: Learn to play the guitar in under four months. Everything you need to know to be able to play your favorite songs
prerequisites: No prior musical experience needed. A guitar is recommended but not required for the initial weeks. Access to a computer or mobile device with internet.
learning_outcomes: Play your favorite songs on guitar within four months. Master essential guitar chords, scales, tablature, and music notation. Develop ear training and performance techniques for guitar.
price: Coursera offers Specializations through a subscription model. The exact price varies, but typically ranges from $49 to $79 per month.

title: Guitar for Beginners
description: Grasp the essentials needed to begin playing acoustic or electric guitar. You'll learn an easy approach to get you playing quickly, through a combination of exploring the instrument, performance technique, and basic music theory.
prerequisites: No prior musical experience required. Access to an acoustic or electric guitar is recommended.
learning_outcomes: Learn fundamental guitar techniques, basic music theory, and performance skills. Explore the instrument and gain the ability to play simple songs quickly. Understand tablature and chords.
price: Coursera offers courses with a free audit option, or a paid subscription for graded assignments and a certificate.

title: Guitar for Beginners
description: Grasp the essentials needed to begin playing acoustic or electric guitar. You'll learn an easy approach to get you playing quickly, through a combination of exploring the instrument, performance technique, and basic music theory.
prerequisites: No prior musical experience is required. Access to an acoustic or electric guitar is recommended.
learning_outcomes: Learn fundamental guitar techniques, explore the instrument, understand basic music theory, and develop performance skills to quickly start playing songs on acoustic or electric guitar.
price: Coursera offers courses with options for free auditing or paid certificates. The specific price for the certificate may vary.

title: Guitar Performance Techniques
description: Your favorite guitarist didn't become your favorite guitarist without the support of other musicians. The most important skill for a guitarist to learn is the exact same skill that was so important in kindergarten: playing well with others. Guitar Performance Techniques gives guitarists the essential and practical skills to play well with others in any ensemble situation. This course begins with daily warm-up techniques that help you prepare for rehearsals, jam sessions, and stage performances. From there, you'll explore chords, time accuracy, tone production, ear training, and the many aspects of jamming with other musicians. Upon successful completion of this course, you will be able to confidently interact with other musicians in a group setting and bring your A-game to any jam session you join.
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of guitar chords and scales
learning_outcomes: Learn warm-up techniques, improve time accuracy and tone production. Develop ear training skills. Learn how to confidently interact and play with other musicians in ensemble settings and jam sessions.
price: Free to audit, paid certificate available

title: Guitar Scales and Chord Progressions
description: You’ve got the guitar basics down: You can strum your guitar and play a few of your favorite songs, but you’re ready to take the tunes to the next level. In Guitar Scales and Chord Progressions you’ll expand your knowledge of scales, chord fingerings, and common chord progressions. You’ll also learn important skills for soloing, creating melodies, and adding depth and dimension to your guitar playing.
prerequisites: Basic guitar playing knowledge (strumming, basic chords). Familiarity with guitar anatomy is helpful.
learning_outcomes: Expand knowledge of scales and chord fingerings, understand common chord progressions, improve soloing skills, learn to create melodies, and add depth to guitar playing.
price: Coursera offers a subscription-based model or individual course purchase options. Please check Coursera for current pricing.

title: Guitar Chord Voicings: Playing Up The Neck
description: Many beginning guitarists have learned the basics of open and movable chord shapes, but want to further expand this chord knowledge. In this course you’ll learn how to construct and play triads and basic 7th chords. You’ll start by creating major and minor triad inversions, and move on to power chords, drop-2 voicings, and learn how to substitute common chords to create a richer harmonic experience for listeners. Throughout the course, you will focus on the notes that chords are made up of, rather than the shape of individual chords. With this knowledge, you will be able to create inversions and different chord voicings up and down, and across the entire fretboard of the guitar, thus unlocking new ways of playing the guitar.
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of guitar chords and open/movable chord shapes.
Familiarity with basic music theory concepts (e.g., major and minor scales).
learning_outcomes: Construct and play triads and basic 7th chords.
Create major and minor triad inversions and drop-2 voicings.
Substitute common chords to enrich harmonic experience.
Create inversions and different chord voicings across the guitar fretboard.
price: Coursera offers courses for free, but to get a certificate you may need to pay
